articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court appears poised to allow emergency abortions in Idaho when a pregnant patient’s health is at serious risk, according to Bloomberg News, which said a copy of the opinion was briefly posted Wednesday on the court's website.
articles.title: The Supreme Court seems poised to allow emergency abortions in Idaho, a Bloomberg News report says

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court on Wednesday sided with the Biden administration in a dispute with Republican-led states over how far the federal government can go to combat controversial social media posts on topics including COVID-19 and election security.
articles.title: The Supreme Court rules for Biden administration in a social media dispute with conservative states

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — What people remember from Joe Biden and Donald Trump’s first debate four years ago are likely the interruptions, the shouting and the “will you shut up, man?”
articles.title: Biden and Trump are set to debate. Here's what their past performances looked like

articles.author: JONATHAN J. COOPER and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Most U.S. adults plan to watch some element of Thursday's presidential debate and many think the event will be important for the campaigns of both President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump, according to a new poll from The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research.
articles.title: Most Americans plan to watch the Biden-Trump debate, and many see high stakes, an AP-NORC poll finds

articles.author: RICK RYCROFT and ROD McGUIRK
articles.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returned to his homeland Australia aboard a charter jet and raised a celebratory clenched fist as his supporters cheered on Wednesday, hours after pleading guilty to obtaining and publishing U.S.
articles.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returns to Australia a free man after US legal battle ends

articles.author: EVELYNE MUSAMBI
articles.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — Kenya's president said on Wednesday he won't sign into law a finance bill proposing new taxes that prompted thousands of protesters to storm the parliament the previous day, leaving several people killed as police opened fire.
articles.title: Kenya's president says he won't sign a finance bill that led protesters to storm the parliament

articles.author: SOPHIA TAREEN and KATHLEEN FOODY
articles.description: WAUKEGAN, Ill. (AP) — The man accused of killing seven people and injuring dozens more at a 2022 Independence Day parade in a Chicago suburb rejected a deal requiring him to plead guilty to seven charges of murder Wednesday in a stunning courtroom scene just days before the second anniversary of the attack.
articles.title: Illinois man rejects deal to plead guilty to 7 murder charges in shooting at 2022 July Fourth parade

articles.author: SYLVIA HUI
articles.description: CLACTON-ON-SEA, England (AP) — Dorothy Carr is fed up with how things are run in her hometown. It’s impossible to get a doctor's appointment through Britain's state-run health care system. Local buses have been canceled.
articles.title: Fed up with the UK Conservatives, some voters turn to the anti-immigration Reform party for answers

articles.author: WAYNE PARRY
articles.description: FREEHOLD, N.J. (AP) — Fighting brain cancer, little Giada Demma was lying in her pediatric hospital bed, her tiny body virtually swimming in a drab green hospital gown.Her cousin Giuliana Demma remembers looking at the 1-year-old and thinking how sad the scene was: a small child awash in an ugly gown several sizes too big for her.
articles.title: Baby cousin with cancer inspires girls to sew hospital gowns for sick kids across U.S. and Africa

articles.author: BRIAN MAHONEY
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Since the lucky numbers came up for the Atlanta Hawks for a surprising victory in the lottery, speculation centered around Alex Sarr and Zaccharie Risacher of France as the players they would consider for the No.
articles.title: Hawks set to make No. 1 pick in the NBA draft, and this year there is mystery about who it will be
